title: Scroll of identify
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Scroll                                                                                         |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Scroll of identify                                                                             |
| Icon | [![Scroll of identify.png](/images/2/27/Scroll_of_identify.png)](/File:Scroll_of_identify.png) |

|   |                                                                              |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A useful magic scroll which identifies the properties of any unknown object. |

Reading a **scroll of identify** allows the player to identify one item ([potion](/Potion "Potion") or [scroll](/Scroll "Scroll")) currently in their inventory. It can also be used on an item on the ground.

## Strategy

- Scrolls of identify become worthless once you identify all potions and scrolls. You can use the **\\** key to see all items you (don't) already know. Note that the game will automatically figure out the 'last' potion/scroll through process of elimination.
- If you have already identified a scroll of identify, You can press ESC to cancel the scroll effect without using it.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), scrolls of identify were more necessary, as weapons, armour, and jewellery did not identify when you stepped on their tile.
- Prior to [0.21](/0.21 "0.21"), wands did not automatically reveal their charge when picked up.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), scrolls of identify would sometimes allow you to identify up to three items in your inventory.

## See Also

- [Identification](/Identification "Identification")

html:
Scroll of identify

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Scroll
Name Scroll of identify
Icon
A useful magic scroll which identifies the properties of any unknown object.

Reading a scroll of identify allows the player to identify one item (potion or scroll) currently in their inventory. It can also be used on an item on the ground.

Strategy

  • Scrolls of identify become worthless once you identify all potions and scrolls. You can use the \ key to see all items you (don't) already know. Note that the game will automatically figure out the 'last' potion/scroll through process of elimination.
  • If you have already identified a scroll of identify, You can press ESC to cancel the scroll effect without using it.

History

  • Prior to 0.27, scrolls of identify were more necessary, as weapons, armour, and jewellery did not identify when you stepped on their tile.
  • Prior to 0.21, wands did not automatically reveal their charge when picked up.
  • Prior to 0.15, scrolls of identify would sometimes allow you to identify up to three items in your inventory.

See Also

  • Identification
Scrolls
